ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Maven 2.05 build not working on Heritrix1.10.2-src

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Maven 2.05 build not working on Heritrix1.10.2-src
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=pEqgr1WvGHU2Dt9Vc7hCErIe97FDjR5g93uyIbbkShcI

Actually, we're still using an archaic version of Maven -- 1.0.2 -- for 
builds, and 2.x is not yet an option. See here:

   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#N1004E

A move to Maven 2 is in the works.

Thanks for your kind words about the Heritrix project!

- Gordon @ IA

Kaleb wrote:
> I've downloaded the latest Heritrix src tar.gz onto my Linux box.  I'm
> using Maven 2.05, Sun's JDK1.6, and the Heritrix1.10.2-src.  When I
> type "mvn /path/to/heritrix-src" I get the Mavin error: 
> 
> -
> [INFO] Invalid task '/home/user/Desktop/heritrix-1.10.2/': you must
> specify a valid lifecycle phase, or a goal in the format plugin:goal
> or pluginGroupId:pluginArtifactId:pluginVersion:goal
> -
> 
> Does anyone know what causes this?
> 
> Also, under the same setup, I've tried to use the
> cmdline-jmxclient-0.15.5.jar on the binary heritrix1.10.2.  And while
> "java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar - localhost:8849"
> works pefectly, if I try 
> "java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar - localhost:8849
> org.archive.crawler:name=Heritrix,type=Service"
> I get 
> -
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
>         at org.archive.jmx.Client.doBeans(Client.java:332)
>         at org.archive.jmx.Client.execute(Client.java:312)
>         at org.archive.jmx.Client.execute(Client.java:278)
>         at org.archive.jmx.Client.execute(Client.java:256)
>         at org.archive.jmx.Client.main(Client.java:159)
> -
> 
> Anyone know what causes this?
> 
> Other than that, Heritrix is working wonderfully.  I've managed to
> write a JMX client that can fully manage Heritrix from a remote
> client.  And once I figure out how to build Heritrix with Mavin (see
> first issue), I will attempt to write some specialized modules.  But
> I'm a Perl programmer who is unfamiliar with the intracies of Java
> builds/tools, so I forsee a struggle.
> 
> But Heritrix is one of the coolest projects I've ran into in a long
> time.  Great work everyone who contributed!
> 
> 
>
